action.action-desc: Mr. Sherman introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To amend the Truth in Lending Act to require Property Assessed Clean Energy financiers to receive the consent of mortgage holders and other lien holders before providing financing.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Mortgage Borrower Protection Act of 2022.

section.header: Property Assessed Clean Energy financing consent requirement
section.text: Section 128 of the Truth in Lending Act (15 U.S.C. 1638) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Property Assessed Clean Energy financing consent requirement

paragraph.text: With respect to a dwelling of a consumer that is the subject of a residential mortgage loan or other recorded lien, it shall be unlawful to extend Property Assessed Clean Energy financing to the dwelling owner with respect to such dwelling without first receiving the written consent of each owner of each residential mortgage loan and other recorded lien, either directly from the owner or from a servicer.

Consent shall not be required under paragraph (1) from an owner of a residential mortgage loan or other recorded lien if amounts that become due and payable under the applicable Property Assessed Clean Energy financing will not have priority over such residential mortgage loan or other recorded lien.
With respect to any Property Assessed Clean Energy financing extended in violation of this subsectionâ€”

subparagraph.text: such Property Assessed Clean Energy financing shall be null and void; and
the consumer shall not be required to repay any amounts received under the Property Assessed Clean Energy financing.

paragraph.header: Definition of Property Assessed Clean Energy financing
paragraph.text: In this subsection, the term Property Assessed Clean Energy financing has the meaning given that term under section 129C(b)(3)(C)(i).
